meanings.definition: Wild and noisy disorder or confusion; uproar.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was filled with pandemonium when the students started throwing paper airplanes.
meanings.sent2: The concert turned into pandemonium when the famous singer took the stage.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party descended into pandemonium when the cake was accidentally dropped on the floor.
meanings.sent4: As the storm hit, the garden became a pandemonium of swirling leaves and branches.
meanings.sent5: The marketplace was a pandemonium of vendors shouting and customers bargaining.

meanings.definition: A place or scene of riotous uproar or utter chaos.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned amusement park was a pandemonium of broken rides and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent2: The battlefield was a pandemonium of shouting soldiers and clashing swords.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen turned into pandemonium as the chef accidentally set fire to the stove.
meanings.sent4: The city streets at rush hour were a pandemonium of honking cars and frustrated commuters.
meanings.sent5: The zoo became a pandemonium of excited children and roaring animals during feeding time.
